titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter Gizzi Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday May 3, 2019 at 03:08

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Peter Gizzi in the course of his literary activities as a poet, editor, and teacher, and documents the creation of his published books of poetry, the publication of the literary journal O·blēk, and his personal and professional relationships with other writers, poets, and publishers. Material includes correspondence with various literary figures; drafts, notes, and proofs relating to Gizzi's published and unpublished work; manuscripts of work published in O·blēk (Issues 1-12) and related correspondence and general business files; manuscripts and related material for limited editions published by O·blēk Editions; typescripts of works by other writers submitted to Gizzi for his review; lecture notes and teaching material; and other papers relating to various aspects of Gizzi's personal and professional life.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from James S. Jaffe on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 40 (audio cassettes): Use of originals is restricted. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 48-49 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Email files in Series VI: Access is restricted during the lifetime of Peter Gizzi. Consult the appropriate curator for further information.
Files in Series VI. Electronic Files, "Restricted files" folder: restricted until 2020 January 1. Consult the appropriate curator for further information.
Copies of other electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Peter Gizzi Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Peter Gizzi Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Peter Gizzi (1959-)
bioghist.p: Peter Gizzi was born in 1959 and grew up in Pittsfield, Massachusetts. He holds degrees from New York University, Brown University, and the State University of New York at Buffalo. His books include The Outernationale (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2007), Some Values of Landscape and Weather (Middletown, CT: Wesleyan University Press, 2003), Artificial Heart (Providence, RI: Burning Deck, 1998), and Periplum, or, I the blaze (Penngrove, CA: Avec Books, 1992). He has also published many limited edition chapbooks, folios, and artists' books. His work has been widely anthologized and translated into numerous languages.

As an editor, Gizzi has overseen O·blēk: A Journal of Language Arts and The Exact Change Yearbook . He has taught at Brown University and the University of California, Santa Cruz. He is currently on the faculty of the University of Massachusetts at Amherst.
Biographical note is based on that in Poets.org (accessed on 8 June 2010).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of material created and accumulated by Peter Gizzi in the course of his literary activities as a poet, editor, and teacher. The papers and electronic files document the creation of Gizzi's works of poetry, the publication of the literary journal O·blēk , and his personal and professional relationships with other writers, poets, and publishers. Material includes correspondence with literary figures; drafts, notes, and proofs relating to Gizzi's published and unpublished works; manuscripts of work published in O·blēk (issues 1-12), with related correspondence and general business files; manuscripts and related material for limited editions published by O·blēk Editions; typescripts of writings by other writers submitted to Gizzi for his review; lecture notes and teaching material; and other papers relating to Gizzi's personal and professional life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, 1988-2007. II. Writings by Peter Gizzi, 1980-2007. III. O·blēk Files, 1979-2005. IV. Writings by Others, 1990-2007. V. Other Papers, 1960-2006. VI. Electronic Files, 1990s-2009.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into chronological groupings by year or year span. Within individual groupings, correspondence is often arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. consists of incoming professional and personal correspondence, including letters, cards, and email printouts, with writers, authors, publishers, family and friends.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Major Works and Other Writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. consists of typescript and autograph manuscript drafts, proofs, and other material relating to Gizzi's published books of poetry and other writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Published works are arranged chronologically by date of publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes Rosemarie Waldrop correspondence and poems; material sent by Singing Horse Press; a mechanical from Bernard Waldrop; "E.H." by Claude Richard; Peter Gizzi's NYU Undergraduate essays and thesis; "Moss Lotus" by Julia Spicher; Elizabeth Brundage poems; "In Memory of Louie Zukofsky" by Walter James Miller; "Oedipus Rex" notes and writings; the "Ajax Soph." manuscript; a black binder with notes; a brown folder with poems; "Michael's play" and various poems and correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Also includes two photographs of Peter Gizzi, circa 1970s, and negatives.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Journal Submissions, Correspondence, General Business Files, and O·blēk Editions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. consists of material relating to the publication of O·blēk: a journal of the language arts , which was published between 1987 and 1993 and edited by Peter Gizzi with Connell McGrath. Material includes manuscripts, correspondence, page and cover proofs, contracts, subscription lists, financial records, publicity, and related papers. The series also includes material relating to the publication of O·blēk Editions limited edition chapbooks.

Olstein, "The Called-Back Wreck of Things" by Sara Veglahn, "Steady Now, Mr. Sitwell" by Nicole Burdette and Steve Clark, "The Letters of James Schuyler to Frank O'Hara", "Shelley In The Navy-Colored Chair" by Barbara Guest, "Dialect" by Sianne Ngai and other materials and writings.

scopecontent.p: Includes "Air and Such: An Essay on Biotherm", "Kerouac, Berrigan and The Poetics of Providence" by Marisa Januzzi, "Poetic Obligations" by Michael Palmer, "Bazin At Work", "Don't Ever Get Famous" edited by Daniel Kane, "F.Y.I.: Correspondence and The Mutation of Frank O'Hara's Personism", "Knights of Cups", "Confidential Publication Proposal For 'Grave of Light'" by Alice Notley, poems by Stephen Lindow, Robert Creeley memorial material, and Michael Friedman material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes: a letter from Rosmaire Waldrop to Peter Gizzi (2004), Archi Rand correspondence and 35mm slides, a laminated copy of Jess Collins' 1991 cover for O·blēk, Ledger Domain artwork (circa 1995), a selection of poems sent to Howard Grant (1998), a copy of Revival with a "Byrne" photo, a poster for the First Annual St. George Poetry Festival (2001), handouts for the Summer Literary Seminars in Russia (2006), a Barbara Guest memorial poster (2006), a letter and group photos from Cary [Blake?] (2005), Peter Gizzi's SUNY: Buffalo PhD certificate and student transcript, four photographs of Peter Gizzi by Robert Seydel (1977), and mechanicals for Periplum (1992).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Email files: Access is restricted during the lifetime of Peter Gizzi. Files in the "Restricted files" folder: restricted until 2020 January 1.
Copies of other electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Macbook Files, IMac Files, and Computer Disks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The digital component of the Peter Gizzi papers consists of files from two computers, loose disks, and email archives. Files and email were copied off two working computers at Gizzi's residence in Holyoke, MA, on 2009 October 7. The word processing files include drafts of writings, research notes, correspondence, professional documents, and teaching and lecture notes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes folders and files from a Macbook 3.1.

The hard drive on this machine crashed and was restored by an unidentified commercial vendor prior to its acquisition by the library. Most records on the Macbook are dated 2008 March 10 (recovery date). Files created following the hard drive recovery have later dates.

did.unittitle: R E V I V A L

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted during the lifetime of Peter Gizzi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes folders and files from an iMac. Copied files were given the transfer date of 2009-10-07.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 48-49 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
